decks.notes: This deck focuses on quickly getting big creatures into play by using cards that allow for fast graveyard recursion or cheating them into play. By using cards like Goryo's Vengeance and Through the Breach, along with graveyard manipulation cards like Faithless Looting and Cathartic Reunion, the deck can consistently cheat out powerful creatures like Griselbrand and Worldspine Wurm. The deck also includes cards like Nourishing Shoal and Borborygmos Enraged to gain life and deal massive damage to the opponent, providing a versatile and powerful combo strategy.

The main concept of this deck is to play aggressively and quickly deal damage to the opponent, relying on efficient red burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Lava Spike. Utilizing creatures with haste like Goblin Guide and Monastery Swiftspear, as well as Eidolon of the Great Revel to punish opponents for casting spells, the deck aims to finish off the opponent before they can stabilize. The mana base supports the efficient casting of spells and the aggressive playstyle of the deck.

This deck focuses on quickly dealing damage to the opponent using high-powered aggressive red spells and creatures. The key strategy is to maintain a fast-paced tempo by utilizing efficient burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Lava Spike, while also putting pressure on the opponent with creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Goblin Guide. The deck aims to finish off the opponent before they have a chance to stabilize, using cards like Lightning Helix and Boros Charm to close out the game if needed. It is a straightforward and aggressive strategy that aims to win the game quickly.

The main idea of the deck is to control the game by manipulating the top of the opponent's library with cards like Lantern of Insight and Codex Shredder, while also disrupting their hand with cards like Inquisition of Kozilek and Thoughtseize. The deck aims to lock the opponent out of the game using cards like Ensnaring Bridge and Witchbane Orb, while also presenting win conditions through Pyrite Spellbomb and milling the opponent with Pyxis of Pandemonium. The deck has access to various tutors like Whir of Invention to find key pieces and can recur important artifacts with cards like Academy Ruins.

The main concept of this Death and Taxes aggro deck is to disrupt your opponent's game plan by utilizing cards that tax their resources and make it difficult for them to play their spells effectively. By combining cards like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Leonin Arbiter to slow down your opponent, along with disruptive creatures like Tidehollow Sculler and Thought-Knot Seer to strip their hand of important cards, followed by heavy hitters like Eldrazi Displacer and Wasteland Strangler to close out the game, this deck aims to overwhelm and outvalue the opponent in the midrange game.

This deck focuses on assembling the UrzaTron lands (Urza's Tower, Power Plant, Mine) to generate a large amount of mana quickly. It aims to control the game through removal spells like Dismember and Oblivion Stone, while also using cards like Expedition Map and Sylvan Scrying to search for and play powerful threats such as Wurmcoil Engine and Karn Liberated. The deck also includes a variety of color-fixing artifacts and ways to dig through the deck for key cards, ultimately leading to overwhelming opponents with Eldrazi titans and planeswalkers.

This deck focuses on assembling the UrzaTron lands (Urza's Tower, Power Plant, and Mine) to generate a large amount of colorless mana quickly. It utilizes control elements such as Oblivion Stone, Fatal Push, and Relic of Progenitus to disrupt opponent strategies while using Ancient Stirrings and Sylvan Scrying to search for key cards like Wurmcoil Engine, World Breaker, and Karn Liberated. The end game includes powerful threats like Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger and Ugin, the Spirit Dragon to close out the game.

This deck focuses on disrupting your opponent's resources while deploying threats of your own. By utilizing cards like Path to Exile, Leonin Arbiter, and Ghost Quarter, you can keep your opponent off balance while creatures like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Thought-Knot Seer apply pressure. Aether Vial allows you to cheat creatures into play at instant speed, and Eldrazi Displacer and Flickerwisp provide additional disruption and value. The deck aims to control the game through disruption and tempo advantage, ultimately overwhelming the opponent with efficient creatures.

This deck focuses on quickly deploying powerful Eldrazi creatures such as Reality Smasher and Thought-Knot Seer while disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Chalice of the Void and Warping Wail. The deck also includes strong mana acceleration with Expedition Map and Urza lands, allowing for early plays and big threats. Additional disruption comes from cards like Dismember and All Is Dust, while Karn Liberated provides versatile removal and pressure. The overall strategy is to overwhelm the opponent with large creatures and disruptive plays, aiming to control the game and secure victory.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through counterspells, removal, and land disruption while using card draw and planeswalkers to outvalue the opponent. The key strategy is to disrupt the opponent's mana base with land destruction and enchantments like Spreading Seas, while controlling the board with removal spells like Path to Exile and Supreme Verdict. The deck aims to grind out advantages through card advantage and incremental value, eventually overpowering the opponent with powerful planeswalkers like Gideon Jura and Jace, Architect of Thought.

This deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a combination of efficient removal spells and disruptive hand disruption, while also applying pressure with powerful creatures like Tarmogoyf, Siege Rhino, and Grim Flayer. The deck also utilizes token generators like Lingering Souls to provide additional threats and value. The Planeswalkers, Liliana of the Veil and Liliana, the Last Hope, help control the board and provide additional disruption. The deck's mana base is designed to support a variety of powerful spells and creatures while keeping a balanced mix of lands and colors.

The deck focuses on utilizing cards like Lantern of Insight, Codex Shredder, and Ensnaring Bridge to control the opponent's draws and prevent them from effectively playing their cards. It also includes cards like Whir of Invention and Mox Opal to help search for key pieces and ramp into larger threats. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan, lock them out of the game, and eventually win through attrition by controlling the board state and manipulating what cards the opponent has access to.

The deck focuses on controlling the board and disrupting the opponent's game plan through a combination of artifacts and planeswalkers. By using cards like Ensnaring Bridge and Damnation to limit the opponent's options, along with hand disruption spells like Inquisition of Kozilek, the deck aims to buy time and generate advantage. The Tezzeret planeswalkers provide additional threats and card advantage, while the Thopter Foundry and Sword of the Meek combo can create a steady stream of flying tokens. The overall strategy revolves around denying the opponent resources while building a strong board presence.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game through counterspells, removal spells, and versatile threats, while also maintaining card advantage and tempo. By utilizing a mix of permission spells like Spell Snare and Logic Knot, removal spells like Path to Exile and Lightning Bolt, and versatile threats like Spell Queller and Snapcaster Mage, the deck aims to outvalue and outlast the opponent until it can establish a dominant position and close out the game with powerful finishers like Celestial Colonnade and Cryptic Command.

This UR Storm deck focuses on generating mana and card advantage to quickly assemble a combo that can deal lethal damage to the opponent in a single turn. By utilizing cards like Pyretic Ritual, Manamorphose, and Desperate Ritual, along with the cost reduction effects of Goblin Electromancer and Baral, Chief of Compliance, the deck aims to cast multiple spells in a single turn to fuel a lethal Grapeshot or Empty the Warrens. Gifts Ungiven is used to tutor for key combo pieces while also filling the graveyard for flashback spells like Past in Flames.
